snippet: Gunfire rang out in the streets of the strategic town of Gao in northern Mali two weeks after French forces appeared to have chased radical Islamists out of the town.
abstract: Gunfire rings out in streets of strategic town of Gao in northern Mali, two weeks after French forces appeared to have chased radical Islamists from town; battle between Islamists and force of Malian and French troops suggests that quick French campaign is not over and has entered new phase of guerrilla warfare.

byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER and PETER TINTI
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter reported from Dakar, and Peter Tinti from Gao, Mali.

lead_paragraph: Gunfire rang out in the streets of the strategic town of Gao in northern Mali two weeks after French forces appeared to have chased radical Islamists out of the town.

headline.main: Militants Battle Malian and French Troops in Liberated Town
headline.print_headline: Mali Rebels Attack City They Fled Last Month
